com.ibm.team.workitem.common

Interface IWorkItemCommon

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IWorkItemClient

    public interface IWorkItemCommon
    The work item library provides access to work item specific artifacts. On the client it can be obtained as a client library, on the server as a service.
    Since:
    0.5
    See Also:
    IWorkItem, IQueryCommon, IAuditableCommon

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  IWorkItemCommon.ITimeCode

        IWorkItem findWorkItemById(int id,
                         ItemProfile<IWorkItem> profile,
                         org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                           throws TeamRepositoryException
        Returns the work item with the given id or null if not found
        Parameters:
        id - the id
        profile - the profile of the returned work item
        monitor - a progress monitor or null
        Returns:
        the work item with the given profile
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong, and PermissionDeniedException if the authenticated user's privileges are not sufficient
        See Also:
        IWorkItem.getId()

                      IWorkItemType type,
                      org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                        throws TeamRepositoryException

        Throws:

      • updateWorkItemType

        boolean updateWorkItemType(IWorkItem workItem,
                         IWorkItemType newType,
                         IWorkItemType oldType,
                         org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                           throws TeamRepositoryException
        Change the given work item to have the given type, custom attributes of the new type will be added and initialized to their default value iff the work item does not have them already.
        When an old type is given, custom attributes that are in the old type and not in the new type are removed. Custom attributes that are not in the old type and not in the new type are not removed. When no old type is given, no custom attributes are removed.
        Parameters:
        workItem - the work item, must be a working copy
        newType - the new type, must be of the same project area as the work item
        oldType - the old type of the work item
        monitor - a progress monitor or null
        Returns:
        whether the set of custom attributes has changed
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong
        Since:
        0.7
        See Also:
        IItem.isWorkingCopy()

      • findAttribute

        IAttribute findAttribute(IProjectAreaHandle projectArea,
                       java.lang.String identifier,
                       org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                         throws TeamRepositoryException
        Returns the attribute from the given project area with the given identifier or null if no such attribute exists. The returned attribute has the full profile.
        Parameters:
        projectArea - the project area
        identifier - the identifier
        monitor - a progress monitor or null
        Returns:
        the attribute from the given project area with the given identifier or null if no such attribute exists
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong

      • createAttribute

        IAttribute createAttribute(IProjectAreaHandle projectArea,
                         java.lang.String identifier,
                         java.lang.String attributeType,
                         java.lang.String displayName,
                         org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                           throws TeamRepositoryException
        Creates a custom attribute with the given properties, the returned attribute is not a working copy and cannot be changed further. The attribute's identifier must be unique within the project area.
        Parameters:
        projectArea - the project area scope
        identifier - the attribute identifier
        attributeType - the attribute type
        displayName - the attribute name
        monitor - a progress monitor or null
        Returns:
        the created attribute
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong

                            java.lang.String identifier,

                            org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                              throws TeamRepositoryException

        identifier - the attribute identifier
        attributeType - the attribute type
        fullTextKind - the fulltext kind

      • findCategoriesOfProcessArea

        java.util.List<ICategory> findCategoriesOfProcessArea(IProcessAreaHandle processArea,
                                                    ItemProfile<ICategory> profile,
                                                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                      throws TeamRepositoryException
        Finds all categories which are associated with the given process area. Sub-categories which have no explicit team area association inherit the team area from their parent and are therefore included as well.
        Parameters:
        processArea - The process area for which the categories are to be found
        profile - The profile with which to resolve the categories
        monitor - The progress monitor

        TeamRepositoryException

      • setDefaultTeamArea

        void setDefaultTeamArea(ITeamAreaHandle teamArea,
                      org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                        throws TeamRepositoryException
        Sets the default team area for the team area's project area that will be used when a category does not have any other team area associated.

        Note that this potentially writes a new state for all categories in the project area and might introduce save conflicts with other clients. It should only be used for initialization during or shortly after initializing the containing project area.

        Parameters:
        teamArea - the team area
        monitor - a progress monitor or null
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong
        See Also:
        MultiStaleDataException

      • findProcessArea

        IProcessAreaHandle findProcessArea(IWorkItemHandle handle,
                                 org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                   throws TeamRepositoryException
        Returns a handle of the process area the given work item is associated with. This is either a team area of the work item's project area or the work item's project area itself if no team area could be found.

        The team area is computed based on the work item's Filed Against category and Planned For iteration. It is the team area in ICategory.getAssociatedTeamAreas() of the same development as the Planned For iteration iff that exists, or ICategory.getDefaultTeamArea() otherwise.

        Parameters:
        handle - the work item
        monitor - a progress monitor or null
        Returns:
        the process area handle
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong
        See Also:
        IWorkItem.getCategory(), IWorkItem.getTarget()

      • findProcessAreaForCategoryAndIteration

        IProcessAreaHandle findProcessAreaForCategoryAndIteration(ICategoryHandle category,
                                                        IIterationHandle target,
                                                        org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                          throws TeamRepositoryException
        Returns a handle of the process area associated with the passed category and iteration. This is either a team area associated with the passed category or the project area itself if no team area could be found.

        The team area is computed based on the category and iteration. It is the team area in ICategory.getAssociatedTeamAreas() of the same development line as the passed target iff that exists, or ICategory.getDefaultTeamArea() otherwise.

        Parameters:
        handle - to the category
        handle - to the iteration
        monitor - a progress monitor or null
        Returns:
        the process area handle
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong

      • deleteAttachment

        void deleteAttachment(IAttachmentHandle attachment,
                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                      throws TeamRepositoryException
        Deletes given attachment from the repository. Does not fail if attachment is null or does not exit.
        Parameters:
        attachment - to delete
        monitor - Monitor the progress is reported to
        Throws:
        PermissionDeniedException - if authenticated contributor is not authorized to delete attachments from the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
